resources.string: TheTome
https://www.pocketgrimoire.co.uk/en_GB/sheet?
https://wiki.bloodontheclocktower.com/
The Tome
Rename player

Yes
Cancel
Start Game
Player count: %1$d
Scenery:
Choose Scenery
Players: %1$d / %2$d
No Role
Pick a role
Name
New Game
Restore Game
Choose token
Townsfolk
Outsider
Minion
Demon
Traveller
Fabled
State of the game would be renewed
Edit game?
Notes
Add new player?
Delete player?
Delete player
Press again
Rename
Change role
Kill player
Revive player
Show card
Spend Ghost Vote
Return Ghost Vote
Prepare 3 demon bluffs
Prepare bag of roles and pass it to players
Start the First Night Phase
Start the Night Phase
Wait 3–5 minutes and start voting process
Start the Day Phase
Wake all minions, show THIS IS THE DEMON card point to the Demon
Wake Demon, show THESE ARE YOUR MINIONS card point to the minions. Show THESE CHARACTERS ARE NOT IN PLAY card. Show prepared bluffs
This is the Demon
These are your Minions
These characters are not in play
Show a role
Use your ability?
Make a choice
Did you nominate today?
Did you vote today?
This Character Selected You

whoopsie
goal
Trouble Brewing
Bad Moon Rising
Sects and Violets
Uncertain Death
A Lleech of Distrust
No Greater Joy
Laissez un Faire
Imp
Each night, choose a player: they die. If you kill yourself this way, a Minion becomes the Imp

Wake the Imp. The Imp points at any player. The chosen player dies — put the Imps Kill reminder by the chosen players character token If the Imp killed themself at night, choose an alive Minion and replace their character token with a Imp token. Wake the new Imp, show them the YOU ARE info token, then show them the Imp token
Poisoner
Each night, choose a player: they are poisoned tonight and tomorrow day
Wake the Poisoner. They point at any player. Put the POISONED reminder token by the chosen players character token
Spy
Each night, you see the Grimoire. You might register as good - as a Townsfolk or Outsider, even if dead
Wake the Spy and show them the Grimoire for as long as they need
Washerwoman
You start knowing that 1 of 2 players is a particular Townsfolk
Put the Washerwomans TOWNSFOLK reminder token by any Townsfolk character token, and put the Washerwomans WRONG reminder token by any other character token
Wake the Washerwoman and point to the players marked TOWNSFOLK and WRONG. Show the character token marked TOWNSFOLK to the Washerwoman
Librarian
You start knowing that 1 of 2 players is a particular Outsider(Or that zero are in play)
Put the Librarians OUTSIDER reminder token by any Outsider character token, and put the Librarians WRONG reminder token by any other character token
Wake the Librarian and point to the players marked OUTSIDER and WRONG. Show the character token marked OUTSIDER to the Librarian
Investigator
You start knowing that 1 of 2 players is a particular Minion
Put the Investigators MINION reminder token by any Minion character token, and put the Investigators WRONG reminder token by any other character token
Wake the Investigator and point to the players marked MINION and WRONG. Show the character token marked MINION to the Investigator
Chef
You start knowing how many pairs of evil players there are
Wake the Chef. Show the Chef fingers (0, 1, 2, etc.) equaling the number of pairs of neighboring evil players
Empath
Each night, you learn how many of your 2 alive neighbors are evil
Wake the Empath. Show them fingers (0, 1, or 2) equaling the number of evil players neighbouring the Empath
Fortune Teller
Each night, choose 2 players: you learn if either is a Demon. There is a good player that registers as a Demon to you
Put the Fortune Tellers RED HERRING reminder token by any good character token, marking that player as the Red Herring
Wake the Fortune Teller. The Fortune Teller points at any two players. If either chosen player is a Demon or the Red Herring, nod your head yes. Otherwise, shake your head no
Butler
Each night, choose a player (not yourself): tomorrow, you may only vote if they are voting too
Wake the Butler. They point at any player. Mark this player with the MASTER reminder token
During a nomination, the Butler may only have their hand raised to vote if the Master has their hand raised to vote or if the Masters vote has already been counted
Monk

Each night*, choose a player (not yourself): they are safe from the Demon tonight. The Monks protection also prevents all other harmful effects of the Demons ability, such as poisoning or turning the protected player evil
Wake the Monk. The Monk points at any player except themself. If the Demon attacks the player marked SAFE, the player remains alive
Scarlet Woman
If there are 5 or more players alive and the Demon dies, you become the Demon
If the Demon dies and there were five or more alive players immediately before the Demon died, replace the Scarlet Woman token with a spare Demon token. Show them the YOU ARE info token
Ravenkeeper
If you die at night, you are woken to choose a player: you learn their character
If the Ravenkeeper died tonight, wake them. They point at any player. Show the chosen players character token to the Ravenkeeper
Undertaker
Each night*, you learn which character died by execution today
if any player died by execution today, wake the Undertaker. Show the character token marked DIED TODAY to the Undertaker
If a player dies by execution, put the Undertakers DIED TODAY reminder token by the dead players character token
Soldier
You are safe from the Demon
Mayor
If only 3 players live and no execution occurs, your team wins. If you die at night, another player might die instead
Slayer
Once per game, during the day, publicly choose a player: if they are the Demon, they die
Virgin
The 1st time you are nominated, if the nominator is a Townsfolk, they are executed immediately
Saint
If you die by execution, your team loses
Recluse
You might register as evil and as a Minion or Demon, even if dead
You can mark the Recluse with an EVIL token to remind you they look evil
Baron
There are extra Outsiders in play(+2)
While setting up the game, remove any two Townsfolk character tokens and add any two Outsider character tokens
Drunk
You do not know you are the Drunk. You think you are a Townsfolk character, but you are not
Add a Townsfolk role and do not place the Drunk into the bag
Clockmaker
You start knowing how many steps from the Demon to its nearest Minion
Wake the Clockmaker. Show fingers (1, 2, etc.) equaling the distance in players from the Demon to the nearest Minion, starting with the player neighboring the Demon closer to that Minion
Grandmother
You start knowing a good player and their character. If the Demon kills them, you die too
Choose a Grandchild by marking any good character with the GRANDCHILD reminder
Wake the Grandmother and show them the character token marked GRANDCHILD, then point at the Grandchild player, then put the Grandmother to sleep
If the Demon kills the Grandchild, the Grandmother dies
Exorcist
Each night*, choose a player (different to last night): the Demon, if chosen, learns who you are then doesnt wake tonight
Wake the Exorcist. They point at any player. Mark the chosen player’s character token with the CHOSEN reminder. Put the Exorcist to sleep
Flowergirl
Each night*, you learn if a Demon voted today
Each dawn, mark the Flowergirl with the DEMON NOT VOTED reminder. if the Demon votes for any execution, replace the DEMON NOT VOTED reminder with the DEMON VOTED reminder
Wake the Flowergirl. If the Flowergirl is marked DEMON NOT VOTED, shake your head no. If the Flowergirl is marked DEMON VOTED, nod your head yes
Oracle
Each night*, you learn how many dead players are evil
Wake the Oracle. Show fingers (0, 1, 2, etc.) equaling the number of dead evil players
Artist
Once per game, during the day, privately ask the Storyteller any yes/no question
Seamstress
Once per game, at night, choose 2 players (not yourself): you learn if they are the same alignment

Wake the Seamstress. They either shake their head no or point at any two players except themself. If they point at two players, either nod your head yes (to indicate these players have the same alignment) or shake your head no (to indicate these players do not have the same alignment). mark seamstress with the NO ABILITY
Lunatic
You think you are a Demon, but you are not. The Demon knows who you are and who you choose at night
Once all tokens have been returned to you, swap the positions of the Lunatic and Demon tokens in the Grimoire

Wake the Lunatic and act as if they are the Demon. Show them the THESE ARE YOUR MINIONS info token and point to a number of players equaling the number of Minions in play. Show any three good character tokens as bluffs. During the first night, wake the Demon. Show them the YOU ARE info token, then their Demon token. Show them the THIS PLAYER IS info token, then the Lunatic token, then point at the Lunatic player

Wake the Lunatic to act as if they were that Demon. Put a CHOSEN reminder on each player they chose, then put them to sleep. Wake the real Demon, point at the Lunatic, show the Lunatic token to the real Demon, and point at the players that the Lunatic chose. Then the Demon acts as normal
Mutant
If you are "mad" about being an Outsider, you might be executed
Sweetheart
When you die, 1 player is drunk from now on
If the Sweetheart dies, you choose any one player to become drunk - mark this player with the DRUNK reminder. The Sweetheart does not lose this ability when dead
Godfather
You start knowing which Outsiders are in play. If 1 died today, choose a player tonight: they die. [-1 or +1 Outsider]
Before putting the character tokens in the bag, either remove one Townsfolk and add one Outsider or remove one Outsider and add one Townsfolk
Wake the Godfather. Show them the character tokens of all Outsiders in play
If an Outsider dies during the day, mark them with the DIED TODAY reminder
If an Outsider dies during the day, That night, wake the Godfather. They point at any player, they dead
Assassin
Once per game, at night*, choose a player: they die, even if for some reason they could not
wake the Assassin. They either shake their head no or point at any player
Marionette
You think you are a good character, but you are not. The Demon knows who you are. [You neighbor the Demon]

Add some Townsfolk role and do not place Marionette to a bag. After setting up mark Demon neighbor good player as Marionette. During the first night, Wake the Demon. Point to the player marked IS THE MARIONETTE and show the Marionette character token
No Dashii
Each night*, choose a player: they die. Your 2 Townsfolk neighbors are poisoned
The two Townsfolk neighboring the No Dashii become poisoned - mark them with POISONED reminders
Wake the No Dashii. They point at any player. That player dies. put Kill
Pukka
Each night, choose a player: they are poisoned. The previously poisoned player dies then becomes healthy

Wake the Pukka. They point at any player. Put the Pukka to sleep. The chosen player is poisoned — mark them with a POISONED reminder, the other player marked POISONED dies — mark them with a DEAD reminder
Sailor
Each night, choose an alive player: either you or they are drunk until dusk. You cant die
Wake the Sailor. They point at any player. Put the Sailor to sleep. Either the Sailor or this chosen player becomes drunk—mark them with the DRUNK reminder
If the sober Sailor is executed, declare that this player is executed but remains alive
Chambermaid
Each night, choose 2 alive players (not yourself): you learn how many woke tonight due to their ability
Wake the Chambermaid. They point at any two alive players except themself. Show the Chambermaid fingers (0, 1, or 2) equaling the number of chosen characters who woke tonight
Innkeeper
Each night*, choose 2 players: they cant die tonight, but 1 is drunk until dusk

Wake the Innkeeper. They point at any two players. Put the Innkeeper to sleep. Mark the two chosen players with SAFE reminders. One of the chosen players becomes drunk—mark them with the DRUNK reminder. The players marked SAFE cannot die tonight
Remove the SAFE reminders, remove the DRUNK reminder
Gambler
Each night*, choose a player and guess their character: if you guess wrong, you die

Wake the Gambler. They point at any player, then point at any character icon on their character sheet. Put the Gambler to sleep. If the chosen player is a different character from the chosen character icon, the Gambler dies—mark them with the DEAD reminder
Gossip
Each day, you may make a public statement. Tonight, if it was true, a player dies
Each night except the first, if the Gossip made a definite, true public statement today, you choose any player. The chosen player dies—mark them with the DEAD reminder
If the Gossip makes a definite, true public statement, put the Gossip’s DEAD reminder in the center of the left side of the Grimoire as a reminder to yourself to place it tonight
Courtier
Once per game, at night, choose a character: they are drunk for 3 nights and 3 days

Wake the Courtier. They either shake their head no or point at any character icon on their character sheet. If the Courtier chose a character icon and that character is in play, the player of the chosen character becomes drunk for three nights and three days. Mark them with the Courtier’s DRUNK reminder
Professor
Once per game, at night*, choose a dead player: if they are a Townsfolk, they are resurrected
Wake the Professor. The Professor either shakes their head no or points to a dead player. Put the Professor to sleep. If the Professor chose a dead Townsfolk, the chosen player becomes alive
Minstrel
When a Minion dies by execution, all other players (except Travellers) are drunk until dusk tomorrow
if a Minion dies by execution, all other players except Travellers become drunk. put the Minstrel’s EVERYONE IS DRUNK. At dusk tomorrow, all players made drunk by the Minstrel become sober
Tea Lady
If both your alive neighbors are good, they cant die
If both alive neighbours of the Tea Lady are good, mark those neighbours’ character tokens with the Tea Lady’s CANNOT DIE reminders
If both alive neighbours of the Tea Lady are good, mark those neighbours’ character tokens with the Tea Lady’s CANNOT DIE reminders
Pacifist
Executed good players might not die
If a good character is executed, declare either that they die or they remain alive
Fool
The 1st time you die, you dont
If the Fool would die, they remain alive
If the Fool would die, they remain alive
If the Fool would die, they remain alive
Goon
Each night, the 1st player to choose you with their ability is drunk until dusk. You become their alignment
At night, if a player chooses to use their ability on the Goon and nobody is marked with the Goon’s DRUNK reminder, this player immediately becomes drunk. Change Goon Alignment
Tinker
You might die at any time
Moonchild
When you learn that you died, publicly choose 1 alive player. Tonight, if it was a good player, they die
Tonight, the good player marked with the Moonchild’s DEAD reminder dies
When you learn that you died, publicly choose 1 alive player. mark their character token with the DEAD reminder
Devils Advocate
Each night, choose a living player (different to last night): if executed tomorrow, they dont die
Wake the Devil’s Advocate. They point at any player. Put the Devil’s Advocate to sleep. Mark the chosen player with the SURVIVES EXECUTION reminder
If a player marked SURVIVES EXECUTION is executed, declare that the player was executed but remains alive
Mastermind
If the Demon dies by execution (ending the game), play for 1 more day. If a player is then executed, their team loses
If the Demon is executed and dies, and the game would end, continue playing the game
Zombuul
Each night*, if no-one died today, choose a player: they die. The 1st time you die, you live but register as dead
if no player is marked DIED TODAY, wake the Zombuul. They point at any player
If a player dies, mark them with the DIED TODAY reminder
Shabaloth
Each night*, choose 2 players: they die. A dead player you chose last night might be regurgitated

Just before waking the Shabaloth, you can choose one character marked with the Shabaloths DEAD reminder, and the chosen player becomes alive again. Wake the Shabaloth. They point at any two players, one at a time. In the order chosen, each chosen player dies—mark them with DEAD reminders
Po
Each night*, you may choose a player: they die. If your last choice was no-one, choose 3 players tonight

Wake the Po. They either shake their head no or point at any player. If they shook their head no, mark the Po with the 3 ATTACKS reminder. If they chose a player, that player dies—mark them with a DEAD reminder. If the Po wakes to act while marked 3 ATTACKS, they point at any three players, one at a time. In the order chosen, each chosen player dies—mark them with DEAD reminders
Dreamer
Each night, choose a player (not yourself or Travellers): you learn 1 good and 1 evil character — one is correct
Wake the Dreamer. They point at any player. Show their character token and any other team affiliation token
Snake Charmer
Each night, choose an alive player: if its the Demon, you swap characters and alignments and they become poisoned

Wake the Snake Charmer. They point at any player. If that player is not the Demon, nothing happens. If that player is the Demon, swap their roles and POISON old demon player. Show YOU ARE cards for both players accordingly
Mathematician
Each night, you learn how many abilities worked abnormally since dawn due to another ability
Wake the Mathematician. Show fingers (0, 1, 2, etc.) equaling the number of characters with ABNORMAL reminders
Town Crier
Each night* you learn if a Minion nominated today
Wake the Town Crier. If the Town Crier is marked MINION NOMINATED, nod your head Yes. Else - no
if any Minion makes a nomination, put MINION NOMINATED reminder
Savant
Each day, you privately learn two statements: one true and one false
Philosopher
Once per game at night, choose a good character: you gain their ability. If they are in play, they become drunk
Wake the Philosopher. They either shake their head no or point at any Townsfolk icon or any Outsider icon on their character sheet
Juggler
On your first day, publicly guess up to 5 players characters; that night you learn how many were correct
Wake the Juggler. Show them fingers (0, 1, 2, etc.) equaling the number of CORRECT reminders
If the Juggler declares that they are using their ability, up to 5 guesses, put CORRECT reminder for each correct guess
Sage
If the Demon kills you, you learn that the Demon is one of two players
If Demon killed Sage, wake the Sage. Point at two players, one of whom is the Demon that killed the Sage
Barber
If you die today or tonight, the Demon may choose 2 players (not another Demon) to swap characters

If the Barber dies, mark them with the HAIRCUTS reminder. During that night, wake the Demon. Show them the THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU info token, then the Barber token. The Demon either shakes their head no or points to two players. If the Demon pointed to two players, swap the character tokens of the chosen players. One at a time, wake each swapped player, show them the YOU ARE info token
If the Barber dies, mark them with the HAIRCUTS TONIGHT reminder
Klutz
When you learn that you died, publicly choose an alive player: if they are evil, good loses
Evil Twin
You and an opposing player know each other. If the good twin dies, evil wins; good cannot win while both live
Choose a Good Twin by marking any good character with the TWIN reminder
Wake both Twins. Let them make eye contact. Point at the Evil Twin, then show the Evil Twin token to the Good Twin. Point at the Good Twin, then show the Good Twin’s character token to the Evil Twin
Witch
Each night, choose a player: if they nominate tomorrow, they die (unless only 3 players live)
Wake the Witch. They point at any player. Put the Witch to sleep. Mark the chosen player with the CURSED reminder
If player with CURSED reminder makes a nominee, he die immediately
Cerenovus
Each night, choose a player and a good character: that player is “mad” about being that character tomorrow

Wake the Cerenovus. They point at any player and at any Townsfolk or Outsider icon on their character sheet. Mark the chosen player with the MAD reminder. Wake this player, show them the THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU info token, then the Cerenovus token and chosen role
Pit Hag
Each night*, choose a player and a character: they become that character. If you create a Demon, deaths tonight are arbitrary

wake the Pit Hag. They point at any player and any character icon on their character sheet. Put the Pit-Hag to sleep. If the chosen character is in play, nothing happens. If the chosen character is not in play, wake the chosen player. Show them the YOU ARE info token, then their new character token
Fang Gu
Each night*, choose a player: they die. The first Outsider this kills becomes Fang Gu and you die instead. (+1 Outsider)
Return to Settings screen and add one extra Outsider character token and remove one Townsfolk character token

Wake the Fang Gu. They point at any player. If the chosen player is not an Outsider, that player dies—mark them with the DEAD reminder. If the chosen player is an Outsider and this is not the first time in game, that player dies—mark them with the DEAD reminder, otherwise, kill the Fang Gu and replace the Outsider with the Fang Gu
Vigormortis
Each night*, choose a player: they die. Minions you kill keep abilities and poison a Townsfolk neighbour. (-1 Outsider)
Return to Settings screen and remove one Outsider character token and add one Townsfolk character token

Wake the Vigormortis. They point at any player. If the chosen player isn’t a Minion, that player dies - mark them with a DEAD reminder. If the chosen player is a Minion, that player dies - mark them with a DEAD reminder and a HAS ABILITY reminder. The closest clockwise or closest counterclockwise Townsfolk to the Minion becomes poisoned
Vortox
Each night*, choose a player: they die. All Townsfolk info is false. If no execution occurs, evil wins
While the Vortox is alive, you must give false information whenever a Townsfolk ability prompts you to give information
Wake the Vortox. They point at any player. That player dies - mark them with the DEAD reminder
While the Vortox is alive, you must give false information whenever a Townsfolk ability prompts you to give information
Pixie
You start knowing 1 in-play Townsfolk. If you were mad that you were this character, you gain their ability when they die
Mark a Townsfolk character token with the Pixie’s MAD reminder
Wake the Pixie. Show the Pixie this Townsfolk character token with her MAD reminder
Fisherman
Once per game, during the day, visit the Storyteller for some advice to help your team win
Lleech
Each night*, choose a player: they die. You start by choosing a player: they are poisoned. You die if and only if they are dead
Wake the Lleech. They point at any player. That player is poisoned
Wake the Lleech. They point at any player. That player dies—mark them with the DEAD reminder
Balloonist
Each night, you learn a player of a different character type than last night. [+0 or +1 Outsider]
During setup, you may add an Outsider
Wake the Balloonist. Point to the player without KNOW. mark this player KNOW. each type of characters can have only one KNOW
Amnesiac
You do not know what your ability is. Each day, privately guess what it is: you learn how accurate you are
Decide what ability the Amnesiac player has. Make a note
Wake Amnesiac if needed
Cannibal
You have the ability of the recently killed executee. If they are evil, you are poisoned until a good player dies by execution

If a good player dies by execution, mark them with the LUNCH reminder, and remove the Cannibal’s POISONED reminder if necessary. The Cannibal now has this good player’s ability (do not say which), and will wake at night when this good character would normally wake. If an evil player dies by execution, mark them with the LUNCH reminder and mark the Cannibal with the POISONED reminder
Wake Cannibal if needed
Widow
On your 1st night, look at the Grimoire and choose a player: they are poisoned. 1 good player knows a Widow is in play
Mark a good player with the KNOW reminder

Wake the Widow and show them the Grimoire as long as needed. The Widow points to a character token in the Grimoire. Mark them with a POISONED reminder. Wake the player marked KNOW. Show them the Widow character token
Goblin
If you publicly claim to be the Goblin when nominated and are executed that day, your team wins

If the Goblin claims to be the Goblin when nominated (and before voting begins), declare that this player has claimed to be the Goblin, so that all the group hears. Put the CLAIMED reminder by the Goblin token. If the Goblin is executed, and they are marked CLAIMED, then declare that evil wins
Leviathan
If more than 1 good player is executed, evil wins. All players know you are in play. After day 5, evil wins
Mark the Leviathan with the DAY X reminder, where X is day counter
Scapegoat
If a player of your alignment is executed, you might be executed instead
You can execute Scapegoat instead of current executee of same team
Gunslinger
Each day, after the 1st vote has been tallied, you may choose a player that voted: they die
Remind Gunslinger that he can use his ability
Beggar
You must use a vote token to vote. If a dead player gives you theirs, you learn their alignment. You are sober and healthy
Bureaucrat
Each night, choose a player (not yourself): their vote counts as 3 votes tomorrow
Wake the Bureaucrat. They point at any player. Mark the chosen player with the Bureaucrat’s 3 VOTES reminder
Each time you tally the vote of a player marked 3 VOTES, count it as three votes instead of one
Thief
Each night, choose a player (not yourself): their vote counts negatively tomorrow
Wake the Thief. They point at any player. Mark the chosen player with the Thief’s NEGATIVE VOTE reminder
Each time you tally the vote of a player marked NEGATIVE VOTE, count it as subtracting one vote instead of adding one vote
Butcher
Each day, after the 1st execution, you may nominate again
Remind the Butcher: immediately after a player is executed, the Butcher may nominate a player for execution
Bone Collector
Once per game, at night*: choose a dead player — they regain their ability until dusk

Wake the Bone Collector. They either shake their head no or point at any dead player. Put the Bone Collector to sleep. If they pointed at a dead player, the chosen player regains their ability—mark their character token with the Bone Collector’s HAS ABILITY reminder. (They may need to be woken tonight to use their ability.) The Bone Collector loses their ability—mark them with their NO ABILITY reminder. The next dusk, the chosen player loses their ability—remove the HAS ABILITY reminder
Harlot
Each night*, choose a living player: if they agree, you learn their character, but you both might die

Wake the Harlot. The Harlot points at any player. Put the Harlot to sleep. Wake the chosen player, show them the THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU info token, then the Harlot token. That player either nods their head yes or shakes their head no. If they nodded their head yes, wake the Harlot and show them the chosen player’s character token. Put the Harlot to sleep. You may decide that both players die
Barista
Each night, until dusk, 1) a player becomes sober, healthy gets true info, or 2) their ability works twice. They learn which

Remove previous reminders then put the Barista’s SOBER AND HEALTHY reminder or their ACTS TWICE reminder by any character token. Wake that character’s player and show them the THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU info token, the Barista token, then one finger (to show they are sober and healthy) or two fingers (to show they act twice)
Deviant
If you were funny today, you cannot die by exile
Apprentice
On your 1st night, you gain a Townsfolk ability (if good) or a Minion ability
Matron
Each day, you may choose up to 3 sets of 2 players to swap seats. Players may not leave their seats to talk in private
Voudon
Only you and the dead can vote. They dont need a vote token to do so. A 50% majority isnt required
Remind players about Voudon ability
Judge
Once per game, if another player nominated, you may choose to force the current execution to pass or fail
Bishop
Only the Storyteller can nominate. At least 1 opposing player must be nominated each day
Cacklejack
Each day, choose a player: a different player changes character tonight
replace any player’s character token with a different character token without NOT ME reminder. Wake that player. Show the YOU ARE info token, and their new character token
Every day Cacklejack pick a player. put the NOT ME reminder to this player
Gangster
Once per day, you may choose to kill an alive neighbor, if your other alive neighbor agrees
Gnome
All players start knowing a player of your alignment. You may choose to kill anyone who nominates them
Angel
Something bad might happen to whoever is most responsible for the death of a new player

Declare that the Angel is in play. Declare which player or players it is protecting, with their consent. Add the Angel token and their reminders to the Grimoire, and mark each protected player with a PROTECTED reminder. If a player marked PROTECTED dies, something bad happens to the player responsible for the death. You may need to mark their character token with the SOMETHING BAD reminder
Buddhist
For the first 2 minutes of each day, veteran players may not talk
Declare that the Buddhist is in play
Doomsayer
If 4 or more players live, each living player may publicly choose (once per game) that a player of their own alignment dies
Declare that the Doomsayer is in play
Hells Librarian
Something bad might happen to whoever talks when the Storyteller has asked for silence
Declare that the Hells Librarian is in play
Fiddler
Once per game, the Demon secretly chooses an opposing player: all players choose which of these 2 players win
Declare that the Fiddler is in play
Revolutionary
2 neighboring players are known to be the same alignment. Once per game, 1 of them registers falsely/nomination rules to produce a sudden-change win condition or to rebalance a scripted game
Declare that the Revolutionary is in play
Toymaker
The Demon may choose not to attack and must do this at least once per game. Evil players get normal starting info
Declare that the Toymaker is in play
Djinn
Use the Djinns special rule. All players know what it is
Declare that the Djinn is in play
Duchess
Each day, 3 players may choose to visit you. At night*, each visitor learns how many visitors are evil, but 1 gets false info
Declare that the Duchess is in play
If exactly three players have VISITOR reminder, wake them and give appropriate information
Fibbin
Once per game — 1 good player may receive incorrect info instead of correct
Declare that the Fibbin is in play
Sentinel
There might be 1 extra or 1 fewer Outsider in play
Declare that the Sentinel is in play. Add or remove outsider as you wish
Spirit of Ivory
There cant be more than 1 extra evil player
Declare that the Spirit of Ivory is in play
Deus ex Fiasco
At least once per game, the Storyteller will make a mistake, correct it, and publicly admit to it
Declare that the Deus ex Fiasco is in play
Ferryman
On the final day, all dead players regain their vote token
Zenomancer
One or more players each have a goal. When achieved, that player learns a piece of true info
Declare that the Zenomancer is in play
During first night wake players and give them goals. mark these players
Bootlegger
This script has homebrew characters or rules
Declare that the Bootlegger is in play
Tor
Players dont know their character or alignment. They learn them when they die
Declare that the Tor is in play
Storm Catcher
Name a good character. If in play, they can only die by execution, but evil players learn which player it is
Declare that the Storm Catcher is in play. Declare which good character is favoured by the Storm Catcher. If the favoured character is in play, mark them with the Storm Catchers SAFE reminder

wake each evil player in turn. If a good character is marked with the Storm Catcher’s SAFE reminder, show the evil player the THIS PLAYER IS info token, the good character token, point to the good player. If no one is marked with the Storm Catcher’s SAFE reminder, show the evil player the THESE CHARACTERS ARE NOT IN PLAY info token and the good character token
Gardener
The Storyteller assigns 1 or more players characters
Declare that the Gardener is in play. Manually assign roles to players
Big Wig
Each nominee chooses a player: until voting, only they may speak and they are mad the nominee is good or they might die
Declare that the Big Wig is in play
